sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个名词均有"真实"之意。
means: reality ： 侧重指某事物的客观存在的真实性。
truth ： 含义广泛，指符合事实、没有错误或虚假。

sentence.Network_en: The reality of mothering is frequently very different from the romantic ideal.
sentence.Network_cn: 养育孩子的现实经常与浪漫的理想大相径庭。

sentence.Network_en: This just shows how divorced from reality she's become.
sentence.Network_cn: 这恰恰说明了她变得多么不切实际。

sentence.Network_en: He came across as streetwise, but in reality he was not.
sentence.Network_cn: 他给人的印象是很适应都市生活，但实际上并非如此。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 这里的争论，牵涉了现实（reality）与再现 （representation）间的关系。亦即，是否有个称为历史的现实可以如实再现；或者，所 …
他使得人们以错误，或者扭曲的眼光来看待真实(reality)。这种有时被称做虚假意识(false consciousness)的状态，使人安于其悲惨的 …
实在论，顾名思义，就是关于实在(reality)的一般理论。所谓实在，是指事物本身的真实存在性。
高中英语必修2_百度百科 ... mathematical adj. 数学的 reality n. 真实;事实;现实 designer n. 设计师.

list.abs: 扩增实境（augmented reality）是将信息放在全球实时影音档案上（通常通过智能手机或是平板电脑呈现），再加上信息或更多复杂 …
增强现实（Augmented reality）（augmented reality）是一种同时包括虚拟世界和真实世界之要素的环境。它的出现与下述科技进步密切相关：计算机图形 …
虚拟现实（Virtual reality）与模拟现实（Simulated reality），一字之差，很容易引起混淆。 不少人把虚拟现实与模拟现实混为一谈。
虚拟实境（Virtual Reality），简称VR技术，也称灵境技术或人工环境，是利用电脑模拟产生一个三度空间的虚拟世界，提供使用者关 …
一方面,它会增加“现实冲击”(Reality Shock)发生的可能性。“现实冲击”指的是期望与现实不相符合时所造成的一种心理上失落感和挫折 …
四个毕业生 (Reality bites) 的 stay ,费城 (Philadelphia) 的 streets of Philadelphia ,新娘不是我 (My best friend's wedding).

jx.jx_en_mean: used to assert that the truth of a matter is not what one would think or expect

lj.lj_ly: the popular view of the Dobermann is of an aggressive guard dog—the reality is very different.
lj.lj_ls: 人们一般认为这种德国种短毛猎犬是一种攻击性的看门狗——事实却大不一样。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: via French from medieval Latin realitas, from late Latin realis 'relating to things' (see real)

encyclopedia.content: 引言 《reality》是电影《La Boum》（初吻）里的主题曲，成为15个国家的冠军歌曲，并在欧洲和亚洲售卖了800万张。演唱者为Richard Sanderson。 歌手：Lisa McClendon 语言：英语 流派：R&B 发行时间：2009-04-28专辑简介 After the great success of 3 previous CDs, Lisa McClendon returns with her fourth highly anticipated CD, Reality (BluSoul Entertainment). Having written and co-produced the majority of the C

entry.def: You use reality to refer to real things or the real nature of things rather than imagined, invented, or theoretical ideas.

example.ex: Fiction and reality were increasingly blurred...
example.tran: 虚构和现实越来越难以区分了。

example.ex: Psychiatrists become too caught up in their theories to deal adequately with reality.
example.tran: 精神病专家太纠结于理论，无法很好地处理现实问题。

entry.tran: （尤指不愉快的或困难的）真实情况，实际情形
entry.def: The reality of a situation is the truth about it, especially when it is unpleasant or difficult to deal with.

example.ex: ...the harsh reality of top international competition...
example.tran: 高层次的国际竞争的严酷现实

example.ex: Other psychoanalysts do accept the reality of child sexual abuse.
example.tran: 其他心理分析师确实接受了儿童性侵犯的现实。

entry.tran: 现实存在;真实发生的事
entry.def: You say that something has become a reality when it actually exists or is actually happening.

example.ex: ...the whole procedure that made this book become a reality...
The reality is that they are poor.

entry.def: You can use in reality to introduce a statement about the real nature of something, when it contrasts with something incorrect that has just been described.

example.ex: He came across as streetwise, but in reality he was not.
example.tran: 他给人的印象是很适应都市生活，但实际上并非如此。

means.word_mean: 1. all of your experiences that determine how things appear to you;

sentences.sentence: "for them demons were as much a part of reality as trees were"

means.word_mean: 2. the state of being actual or real;

sentences.sentence: "the reality of his situation slowly dawned on him"

means.word_mean: 3. the state of the world as it really is rather than as you might want it to be;
4. the quality possessed by something that is real

auth_sentence.content: In reality, that's not far off expectations.
auth_sentence.res_content: In reality, that's not far off expectations.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In reality, that's not far off expectations.

auth_sentence.content: So, reality TV and disabled contestants, eh?
auth_sentence.res_content: So, reality TV and disabled contestants, eh?
auth_sentence.res_content_con: So, reality TV and disabled contestants, eh?

auth_sentence.content: The reality is he's never stopped changing it.
auth_sentence.res_content: The reality is he's never stopped changing it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The reality is he's never stopped changing it.

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真的, 真实的, 不动产的
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实→adj.真的, 真实的, 不动产的
realist[n.现实主义者]+ic……的→adj.现实[主义]的
un不+real真实,现实→adj.不真实的, 虚幻的
real真实,现实+ly表副词→adv.真正地, 实在地
real真实,现实+ism主义→realism现实主义
real真实,现实+ist人→n.现实主义者

stems_affixes.value_cn: 真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ity表名词→n.真实, 事实, 本体, 逼真

stems_affixes.value_cn: 认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行
stems_affixes.word_buile: real真实,现实+ize表动词→v.认识到, 了解, 实现, 实行

Sentence.sentence: But till now, they've been something like a mirage（幻影）in the distance, more like a hazy（模糊的）dream than an actual reality.
But in the end he created a reality of his own, channeling the magic of computing into products that reshaped entire industries.
Collectively, we rely on the unemployment figures and other statistics to frame our sense of reality.
But the idea that statisticians can then capture an objective reality isn't just impossible
They do not fully reflect the reality.

sentences.en: We thought he was serious but in reality he was joking.
sentences.cn: 我们以为他是认真的, 但实际上他是在开玩笑。

sentences.en: The film showed life in the poor areas with great reality.
sentences.cn: 影片非常逼真地展现了贫困地区的生活。

jushi.english: This is not imagination but reality.
He became that country's ruler both in name and in reality.
jushi.chinese: 他成了该国名义上和事实上的统治者。

jushi.english: The film showed life in the poor areas with great reality.
jushi.chinese: 这部影片非常逼真地展现了贫困地区的生活。
